lines: I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest person cannot hold me for much more than a minute.
I can slip through your fingers without a trace.
People try to save me, but everyone loses me eventually.
In the end, I always run out.
I have cities, but no houses.
I have mountains, but no trees.
I have water, but no fish.
I have roads, but no cars.
I have countries, but no people.
I have borders, but no guards.
I have islands, but no beaches.
I have routes, but no travelers.
I have scales, but cannot weigh.
I have a legend, but no myths.
I have a compass, but no magnet.
I have regions, but no governors.
I have colors, but no paint.
I am flat, yet show depth.
I guide many, but move nowhere.
I'm full of holes but still hold water.
I can be soft or rough against your skin.
I'm often hung after being used.
The more you take, the more you leave behind.
I can preserve memories or mark a path.
I follow you everywhere you go.
I fly without wings.
I cry without eyes.
Wherever I go, darkness follows me.
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears.
I have no body, but I come alive with wind.
You can't see me, but I can be heard.
I'm tall when I'm young.
I'm short when I'm old.
I glow when used.
I have keys but no locks.
I have space but no room.
You can enter, but you can't go inside.
I have a head and a tail, but no body.
People flip me to decide things.
I'm often found in pockets and purses.
I'm not alive, but I can grow.
I don't have lungs, but I need air.
I don't have a mouth, but I can drown.
I run all around the backyard, yet never move.
I'm often stepped on, but never seem to mind.
When the weather is warm, I may feel cool beneath your feet.
I can fill a room but take up no space.
I can be felt but not touched or seen.
I come and go as I please.
I can travel around the world while staying in a corner.
I have many faces but no head or body.
I help you get where you're going.
I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case.
I value nothing, but I am used to mark something valuable.
When using me, you almost always leave a mark.
I'm always in front of you, but you can never see me.
No matter how hard you try, you can't reach out and touch me.
As you move, I move too, always staying the same distance away.
I have a face but no eyes, hands but no arms.
I tell you something important, but I never speak.
People look at me daily, but often take me for granted.
I have four legs, but no tail.
I'm not alive, but I support life.
Sometimes I hold food, sometimes books, sometimes people.
I'm found in socks, scarves, and mittens.
I'm often made by grandmothers and stay with you when you're cold.
I'm created by loops within loops.
I'm orange on the outside, white inside, and have seeds you can eat.
I grow on a vine and am harvested in fall.
I can be carved and lit up on a special night.
I have keys that open no locks.
I have space but no room.
I allow you to enter a world of imagination.
I'm easy to lift, but hard to throw.
The stronger the wind, the more I struggle to fly.
I can be made of feathers, rubber, or plastic.
I'm white or colored, but never the same.
I grow larger as I age.
I have many tiny hairs, but people want me bald.
I am gentle enough to soothe your skin, harsh enough to scour your pans.
I'm made of something soft and yet I'm good for scrubbing.
I make things clean but get very dirty in the process.
I'm the source of all light in our solar system.
Plants need me to grow through a special process.
Too much exposure to me can be harmful to your skin.
I start with T, end with T, and have T in me.
You might put things in me to steep.
I'm a container known for holding a hot beverage.
I come in sheets, rolls, and squares.
I can be soft or strong, patterned or plain.
Some people hoard me when disasters loom.
I occur once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years.
I'm always in the middle of the sea, but never in the ocean.
I'm not found in your mouth, but I'm embedded in your teeth.
I am a seed with three letters in my name.
Remove the first letter and I'm a crime.
Remove the second letter instead and I'm an animal.
I'm a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be.
I'm a series of small elements, each serving a purpose.
Look at me from a different way, and I'm no longer the same.
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves.
I have a fork but no knife, and many have me in their home.
You use me when hungry, especially at night.
I get wet when drying.
I'm full of holes, but still hold water.
The more I work, the more I'm consumed.
I'm created by humans yet have no physical form.
I can live eternally, yet never truly die.
I can entertain, educate, or inspire.
I have no mouth, yet I quietly speak,
Marking moments, strong or weak.
I vanish fast when joy is bright,
Yet crawl in sorrow, lost in night.
Born of silence, yet known to all,
Carving sky with patterns tall.
No hands to touch, no feet to stray,
A map of night that fades by day.
Forged in fire, as tough as can be,
A heavy weight champ like Mike Tyson you see.
In Earth's deep core, or a blacksmith's desire,
What am I, strong, yet shaped by the pyre?
Cradling tempests where monsoons ignite,
A path for the traders who vanish from sight.
Spiced with the echoes of empires past,
Vast and relentless, yet holding steadfast.
Walking beside but never ahead,
Stretching long when the sun is red.
Born from light but never bright,
Growing tall in the fading light.
A silent breath upon the land,
Carving glass with a careful hand.
Fragile lace that melts at dawn,
A fleeting kiss before it's gone.
Carving stone yet light as air,
A restless traveler, never there.
A whispering voice, a howling scream,
Shaping mountains and shifting streams.
Swallowing light, yet holding weight,
A hunger vast, a silent fate.
No walls to bind, no door to close,
An endless fall where nothing slows.
Slipping through fingers, yet shaping the world,
A whisper of wealth where fates are unfurled.
Hidden in vaults, sought in despair,
Melting in fire, yet gleaming with care.
Born of silver, fading fast,
A fleeting glow that cannot last.
Guiding wanderers through the night,
Draping shadows in borrowed light.
Weaving threads too fine to see,
A quiet master of what will be.
No voice to speak, no hands to write,
A force unseen but burning bright.
No blade to strike, no breath to take,
Yet still I cause the flesh to break.
A silent thief, a patient foe,
Creeping where the shadows grow.
Climbing high but never falling,
A burning king, the day enthralling.
Gilding lands with molten hands,
Vanishing past the distant sands.
No bricks to build, no walls to see,
Yet within, whole worlds can be.
Bound in silence, rich with sound,
Holding truths that time has found.
No hands to push, yet all obey,
A silent ruler, none betray.
Bending stars and curving fate,
Shaping space at every gate.
Moving slow yet shaping might,
A patient hand, a crushing bite.
No haste to show, no race to run,
Carving valleys, one by one.
A silent twin of those who stare,
Mimicking life, yet always bare.
Shattered once, I break to dust,
Yet stand so clear, reflecting trust.
Lingering where the past remains,
A faded echo locked in chains.
Shaped by joy, etched by pain,
A shadow walking in the brain.
